alert.note: Alert for Champaign; Clark (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 23 at 3:30PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHEASTERN CHAMPAIGN AND NORTHEASTERN CLARK COUNTIES THROUGH 400 PM EDT... At 330 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Springfield, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Springfield, Harmony, Brighton, South Vienna, Catawba, Mutual, Buck Creek State Park, Catawba Station, New Moorefield, Plattsburg and Powhattan. This includes I-70 in Ohio between mile markers 57 and 70. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
